page.title: 02Wyre Forest Vista
page.content: Looking west from the road on the side of Trimpley Hill,the expanse of the Wyre Forest is laid out before you, a dark smooth jigsaw piece fitted into a lighter area textured with fields and hedges. The trees rise steeply from the side of the River Severn and fill the view. There are no landmarks, as the cracks through the forest are obscured by the trees that densely pack the slopes. The valleys of Dowles Brook and its tributaries fold the landscape into softening shades of green as it stretches into the distance, where the crown of Titterstone Clee Hill and the smaller Brown Clee Hill to the right raise their grassy slopes above the dark line of the forest boundary. In Spring new growth makes many hues of green, while in Autumn, mists tone them down to grey, a majestic sight.
